titles.title: A bill to confer jurisdiction on the United States Claims Court with respect to land claims of Pueblo of Isleta Indian Tribe.
An act to confer jurisdiction on the United States Court of Federal Claims with respect to land claims of Pueblo of Isleta Indian Tribe.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S10900-10901)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 680.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.

bill.summary: 9/30/1994--Passed Senate amended. Confers jurisdiction upon the United States Court of Federal Claims with respect to certain land claims of the Pueblo of Isleta Indian Tribe of New Mexico. States that any award to another tribe with regard to such land claims shall not be a defense to any Pueblo of Isleta claim or award.
